Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: Dynamically Assessing Network Security Policy Compliance with NP-Live
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project results from its potential to significantly strengthen the ability of network operators and security administrators to implement the correct set of rules to keep critical assets out of reach of cyber adversaries. The power grid has been said to be the most important engineering achievement of humankind. Modern civilization depends on electricity at such an intrinsic level that we cannot imagine a world without it. In fact, disruptions of power infrastructures quickly lead to chaotic situations in which human lives are at risk. Now that power grid control centers are relying on IT infrastructures, it has become of the utmost importance to ensure the resiliency of systems and networks through methodical IT security protection, monitoring, and response. Through automated continuous verification technologies, this project has a direct impact on the capabilities of our nation to improve its resiliency. The benefits to the power industry, to computer science security, and for society at large are realized through a technological advance that will improve the security of our most important resources.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project plans to develop a constructive approach to providing network security. Cyber security tools are often driven by the necessity to respond to market demand without having the time and resources to develop the proper formalisms and algorithms to solve long-term issues. The innovation proposed here is uniquely positioned to change this paradigm thanks to having roots in both a fundamental academic background and an extensive collaboration with industry partners. Consequently, this project responds to critical customer needs while providing innovations in science, technology, and engineering of critical infrastructure security. The approach the company is taking to compliance assessment has been evaluated in the field and provides a basis for new research leading to theoretically sound solutions to network security modeling, and further development of innovative and provably correct algorithms and tools for accurate and scalable cyber security assessment under real industry constraints.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This research and development project that started in the Summer of 2014 is introducing an innovative approach that changes the way information technology security officers understand and verify the security of their network by providing a working model-based and online security assessment solution. This breakthrough uses device configurations and real-time observations to create a virtual network representation that accurately predicts how packets traverse the network, dynamically updates the state of the network model as configurations change, automatically trains a system to develop global policy rules that defines compliance in a machine checkable form, and provides real-time analysis of global policy. This process leads to unprecedented model accuracy that directly supports network security policy analysis and decision-making. The benefits for network administrators and security operators is to gain higher confidence in their asset security, a greater ability to communicate how their system meets regulatory requirements, as well as to save time and resources by being able to prioritize vulnerability mitigation along with significantly reducing the volume of false alerts. This research is implemented in a software product called NP-Live, designed to meet the need for security and information assurance of networks.

 The impact of this project is particularly significant in the context of critical infrastructures and the energy industry. The electric sector has responded to the challenge of securing and protecting their cyber assets by mandating critical infrastructure protection regulations to be followed by all large electric utilities. Every year, several utilities receive penalties of up to $1,000,000 a day because of violations found in the security of their network following an audit. NP-Live is designed to support utilities and auditors in assessing whether their networks are secure and in compliance with Government NERC/CIP regulations (NERC stands for North American Electric Reliability Corporation and CIP means Critical Infrastructure Protection).

We achieved three major milestones so far. First, we successfully implemented a working prototype of NP-Live that can import firewall and router configurations from a variety of device manufacturers, infer the topology of a network, and run path analysis continuously to generate timely alerts when security and compliance issues are detected. The backend architecture and the frontend interface of NP-Live have built in adaptability to new features and new environments. Second, we implemented a seamless Web-based topology visualization application that allows users to explore their network and highlight connectivity paths and security policy issues. Third, we successfully engaged with a large industry partner to gain a deep understanding of their continuous security and compliance needs. We were able to evaluate the functionalities of the tool with our partners before the end of Phase I.
